title: 103_hr3300
content:
The Act titled "Natural Resource Management on Military Lands Act of 1994" amends the Sikes Act of 1960, which promotes wildlife conservation on military reservations. SEC. 3. INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS FOR MILITARY INSTALLATIONS. Section 101(a) (16 U.S.C. 670a(a)) is amended to require the Secretary to prepare and implement integrated natural resource management plans for each military installation in the United States. The Secretary must prepare integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the United States, with conforming amendments to replace "cooperative plan" with "integrated natural resource management plan" in relevant sections. The Secretary must prepare integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the United States, with amendments replacing "cooperative plan" with "integrated natural resource management plan" in relevant sections. The Secretary is required to prepare integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the United States, with amendments replacing references to "cooperative plans" with "integrated natural resource management plans" in relevant sections. The amendment to Section 101(b) includes provisions for wetland protection, restoration, and creation, consideration of conservation needs for all biological communities, and the establishment of specific natural resources. The amendment includes provisions for wetland protection, restoration, and creation, as well as the establishment of specific natural resource management goals and objectives for proposed actions. The amendment aims to ensure integration and consistency among activities, prevent a net loss in installation lands' capability to support the military mission, sustain public use of natural resources, and provide public access to the installation. The amendment requires public access to military installations for appropriate use, enforcement of natural resource laws, and proper handling of fees collected. Public comment is also mandated by the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Defense must allow public comment on each integrated natural resource management plan. SEC. 4. REVIEW OF MILITARY INSTALLATIONS FOR INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS. The Secretary of each military department must review all military installations in the United States under their jurisdiction to determine which ones require an integrated natural resource management plan. This report must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense within 9 months of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary of Defense must report to Congress within 12 months after the enactment of the Act on the reviews of military installations to determine the need for integrated natural resource management plans. The report should list installations where such plans are not deemed necessary, along with explanations for each. The Secretary of Defense must prepare and implement integrated natural resource management plans for military installations where deemed necessary within 2 years of submitting a report to Congress. Plans must be mutually agreed upon by the Secretary of the Interior and State agencies. The Secretary of Defense must work with appropriate State agencies to amend existing cooperative plans for military installations to comply with integrated natural resource management requirements. The Secretary of Defense must allow public comments on proposed integrated natural resource management plans and changes to cooperative plans. SEC. 5. ANNUAL REVIEWS AND REPORTS. Section 101 (16 U.S.C. 670a) is amended to include a new subsection (g) requiring the Secretary of Defense to review and report on the implementation of integrated natural resource management plans annually by March 1. The report must include the number of plans in effect for the year. The report must include management plans issued or revised, moneys spent on conservation activities, and an assessment of plan implementation. The Secretary of the Interior must submit a report by March 1 each year, assessing compliance of plans with conservation requirements to prevent net loss of lands supporting military missions. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report on the amount of money spent by the Department of the Interior and State agencies on conservation activities related to integrated natural resource management plans to the Committees on Merchant Marine and Fisheries, Armed Services, and Environment and Public Works. SEC. 6 amends Title I to allow the Secretary of Defense to enforce Federal laws related to natural resource conservation on military installations. SEC. 7 addresses natural resource management services. SEC. 7 amends Title I to ensure that each military department has enough trained personnel for natural resource management and law enforcement to comply with the Act. SEC. 8 amends Title I by adding a new section 108 for definitions. The term 'military department' refers to the Department of the Army, Navy, and Air Force. 'Military installation' includes land owned by the US and managed by the Secretary of Defense or a military department, including public lands reserved for defense use. The term 'State fish and wildlife agency' refers to a State government agency responsible for managing fish and wildlife resources in the United States. SEC. 9. SHORT TITLE.

Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended by adding section 109, titled "Short Title," which designates the title as the 'Sikes Act.'

SEC. 10. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS.

(a) Cost Sharing.--Section 103a(b) (16 U.S.C. 670c-1(b)) is amended to replace "matching basis" with "cost-sharing basis."
(b) Accounting.--Section 103a(c) (16 U.S.C. 670c-1(c)) is amended to include specific accounting provisions.

SEC. 11. REPEAL.

Section 2 of the Act of October 27, 1986 (Public Law 99-651; 16 U.S.C. 670a-1) is repealed. Section 2 of the Act of October 27, 1986 (Public Law 99-651; 16 U.S.C. 670a-1) is repealed. Title I of the Act is amended to change references from "military reservations" to "military installations" in various sections. Title I of the Act is amended to change references from "military reservations" to "military installations" in various sections, including section 101(c), section 102, and section 103. SEC. 13. AUTHORIZATIONS OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends sections related to programs on military installations and public lands by updating the years for authorizations of appropriations to 1994, 1995, 1996, and 1997.
